results.title: Broad daylight
results.creator_credit: Derrick Knight and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The development and use of patent glazing from Victorian times to the present day. Shows how patent glazing derived from the needs of expanding Victorian industry, and how it developed techniques so that today it remains completely adaptable to the demands of contemporary design.
results.description: The development and use of patent glazing from Victorian times to the present day. Shows how patent glazing derived from the needs of expanding Victorian industry, and how it developed techniques so that today it remains completely adaptable to the demands of contemporary design.

results.title: The British way of health
results.creator_credit: Richard Marquand and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Outlines the work of the British National Health Service through the eyes of Dr Stone, a London doctor practising in a traditional two-doctor family practice, Dr Gibson, one-time Chairman of the British Medical Association, now senior partner at Friarsgate Medical Centre and Mr Laing, Consultant Plastic Surgeon, who heads an ultra-modern hospital and research unit caring for burned patients.

results.title: A British trade union
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and British Information Services
results.brief_description: An account of the work of a shop steward in a furniture factory is used to illustrate how a British trade union functions. The film gives a comprehensive outline of union organisation, explaining the relationship between employees and their union and between the union, at several levels, and the employers.

results.title: The British policeman
results.creator_credit: David Cobham, Ronald H. Riley, British Information Services and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: Duties of a Police Constable in the United Kingdom - his kindness, his firmness, and discretion in dealing with the routine as well as the dramatic duties he is sometimes called upon to perform. The services of the policeman to the community are many and the responsibilities of the public in co-operation with their guardians of law and order are illustrated.

results.title: British locomotives
results.creator_credit: Clifford Hornby, G. Buckland-Smith, Humphrey Swingler and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: The development of the British locomotive from 1825 to the latest and most powerful diesel and electric locomotive. Shows British Railway’s modernisation plan, different categories of locomotives and rolling stock, specially produced for overseas markets, in operation in different parts of the world.

results.title: British Empire Games, 1950
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of the opening and closing ceremonies of the 1950 British Empire Games held in Auckland, New Zealand and covers many of the sporting events including track and field, boxing, weight-lifting, fencing and rowing.

results.title: The British Commonwealth of Nations
results.brief_description: A survey of the historical and economic factors on which the Commonwealth was built; the trading companies, the missionary movement, empire builders, the freeing of colonial governments, provide a background for an understanding of the Commonwealth. Analyses the political, social and economic interests and ties which have held the nations together and its importance on world history.
